S.FORM: pəhile uhile iŋga cuːktaŋŋɛllɛ akkhɛn bahrə tehrə bərsə yoraŋ khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ amba sintola bəgan lɛptɛ.
S.TRANSL: Before when I was little — I was about 12 or 13 — my father took a contract on some orange groves.

S.FORM: sərdar kam cogɛ.
S.TRANSL: He worked as a contractor.

S.FORM: kudzum thiknu dzogusi.
S.TRANSL: He and a friend did it.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ iŋga pekŋa phɛaŋ kɔ a rəhər thaŋɛ — asira thaŋɛ sikkim pekŋa phɛaŋ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: Then I really wanted to go — I wanted to go to Sikkim.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ tehrə bərsə rɔt yoraŋ khɔmbhɛllɛ.
S.TRANSL: I was only thirteen.

S.FORM: pegaŋŋaŋ kɔ pegaŋ khɛtnasiŋŋaŋ pegaŋ. ambarɛ mɛbaŋsaŋŋɛn.
S.TRANSL: I went — I ran away and went. My father didn't let me go.

S.FORM: niyaːn sumyaːn pəhile khunɛ thasiŋ pe.
S.TRANSL: He had set out two or three days before.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kuegaŋnu khɛtnasiŋŋaŋ pegaŋŋaŋ timduŋ teˀruŋŋaŋ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: So I ran off after him and followed along.

S.FORM: sintola kuyumbɛ səikəɖa səi rɛ akkhɛn dui rupiya thiklɔt mɛbɛrigɛ nambhakp'ɛn.
S.TRANSL: We carried oranges — they only gave us two rupees per hundred, for the Namphak ones.

S.FORM: nambhakpa khɔmbharɔt mɛbɛrigɛ.
S.TRANSL: That was all they gave us for the Namphak ones.

S.FORM: tho maŋdziŋŋɛn cəĩ tin rupiya səikəɖa mɛbɛrigɛ,
S.TRANSL: They gave us three rupees per hundred for the Mangjing ones.

S.FORM: tərə khɔtthonu cəĩ tin rupiya səikəɖa ɛtmu abhedaŋba phɛllɛ
S.TRANSL: But from up there — how it was to get three rupees per hundred —

S.FORM: cɛːtcik alla yusik ɛmbhɛrɛ anda bihan dik pekma sintola n tupma nam thadha tupma waːtmaŋ kɔ kɔk cokma ɖoko 'tmu kɔk cokma waːtmaŋ ɛtyo — ɛtyo adhi lam yumaŋ kɔ khatyo nɛma poŋ.
S.TRANSL: First in the morning, when it was still a bit dark, one had to go and pick oranges all day and make basket-loads and bring them halfway back down and sleep there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ bihan dik thamasiŋ pekmaŋ kɔ yo siŋtam huŋmunaba.
S.TRANSL: Then in the morning you had to set out and go down to Singtam and dump them off.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ iŋga kɔ yɔllik kuma mɛnchukpa.
S.TRANSL: I couldn't carry a lot.

S.FORM: tehi pãc səi pãc səi thik kəhile car səi pəccas kəhile pãc səi thik kuyuŋba.
S.TRANSL: I'd carry five hundred or so — sometimes 450, sometimes five hundred.

S.FORM: tərə khɔtmunu yammu khɔmbhɛ huŋuŋba kəhile chə rupiya sat rupiya thik taːktuŋba.
S.TRANSL: Delivering them from there sometimes I'd get six or seven rupees.

S.FORM: khɔllɛ yaˀs'yaˀ — khɔmbhɛllɛ yaˀs'yaˀ səsto nɛssɛ — the — ser rɛ — pãc suka ser rɔt nɛssɛ — dui ser yaˀs'yaˀ iŋuŋ.
S.TRANSL: With that I'd buy rice — then rice was cheap — it was 1.25 a seer (900g)— I'd buy two seer.

S.FORM: iŋumbɛaŋ khɔmbhɛ sa iŋumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We bought it and we bought meat.

S.FORM: sa iŋumbɛaŋ ɛttho anigɛ ɖera 'tmu yammu thaŋigɛaŋ nɛssigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We brought it up and stayed in our quarters.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ sɛndik yaˀ kɛlaːkp'ɛn yaˀ mɛlaːk besəri .
S.TRANSL: At night, the paddy-dancers paddy danced — a lot.

S.FORM: sam kɛlob'ɛn sam mɛlo.
S.TRANSL: The singers sang.

S.FORM: kɛwaˀ — kɛyuŋb'ɛn mɛyuŋ.
S.TRANSL: Those who just sat around sat around.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ adharat thɛllik yuŋma poŋ.
S.TRANSL: We had to stay until midnight.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ khɔmbhɛ yaˀ mɛlaːk.
S.TRANSL: They paddy-danced.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ mɛim.
S.TRANSL: And they slept.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ bihan dik yammu sɛndik mɛbokkaŋ kɔ pekmunaba pokmunaŋ kɔ sintola tupsɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then in the morning, when it was still night they got up and went to pick oranges.

S.FORM: pekmuna pekmuna tho ɛtna sintola kuma tupma waːtmaŋ kɔ. yammu uhi kubhɛrɛk lam yuŋmunaba.
S.TRANSL: They went up and picked and carried oranges, and again they stayed over halfway back.

S.FORM: tərə khɔmbhɛ kam cogigɛ taːndi.
S.TRANSL: We worked like that.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ amba thasiŋŋaŋ phɛrɛ pe taːndi kɔ.
S.TRANSL: Then later my father came.

S.FORM: iŋga kɔ khɛtnasiŋŋaŋ kɔ yammu sintola kuma mɛnchukpa.
S.TRANSL: I ran off and couldn't carry oranges any more.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ tho pegaŋ ɛtmu anigɛ'tmu meribuŋ e mahila mɛmɛttub'ɛllɛ meribuŋge mahila rɛ tho lam tɔma siŋtam kudhuŋdaŋ lam tɔma peʈi sərdar khunɛ lie ba coguaŋ nɛssɛ.
S.TRANSL: I went up, and up above Singtam someone called Meribung Maila from our village had taken a subcontract for digging a road.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ lie ba coguaŋ nɛssɛ khɔmbhɛ taːndi ni khɔtmu lam tɔm'ɛtmu lasaŋ.
S.TRANSL: He'd taken the subcontract, and later I got into road-digging there.

S.FORM: lasaŋ yagaŋ — yagaŋ taːndi khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ amba phɛrɛ be ɛtna himna.
S.TRANSL: I stayed at it and later my father came back over here — back home.

S.FORM: iŋga yagaŋ yagaŋ taːndi tɔŋbe thik the yagaŋ.
S.TRANSL: I stayed a year.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ kam cogumbɛ. khɔmbhɛaŋ cogumbɛ cogumbɛ khɔmbha lam tɔmaŋ surumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We worked and worked, and finished digging the road.

S.FORM: surumbɛaŋ kɔ pemen tələb taːkma bela 'llɛ kɔ na kam cogumbɛ ɛmbhɔ luŋdhakke mɛsɛttub'ɛn khɔnnɛn khan peʈi sərdar lɛ lie ba cogub'ɛn anigɛ cogumbɛb'ɛn kam ɛn kɔ thubɛ khɛrɛ.
S.TRANSL: We finished, and when it was time to get paid — we'd worked and built retaining walls, and what that subcontractor had built — what we had built — it collapsed.

S.FORM: thubɛ khɛrɛaŋ kɔ bəŋ ! lɔˀ thubɛ khɛrɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ taːndi kɔ —
S.TRANSL: It came down with a crash.

S.FORM: taːndi kɔ hoit lɔrik yammu pəisa rokuwa mɛdzogu.
S.TRANSL: So they immediately stopped the money.

S.FORM: pəisa rokuwa mɛdzoguaŋ kɔ yapmi mɛmbɛrɛn.
S.TRANSL: They stopped it and didn't give it to us.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ khan peʈi sərdar ɛn mɛtmunaba meribuŋge mahila aŋ anigɛ kɔ kulli 'llɛ hektumbɛ,
S.TRANSL: Then we laborers started beating up that subcontractor Meribunge Maila.

S.FORM: "anigɛ kam cogumbɛba pəisa n abɛrɛ!"
S.TRANSL: "Give us the money for our work!

S.FORM: " ləu anigɛ yammu cəĩ yammu cəĩ anigɛ mɛdzogumbɛn," mɛttumbɛ, mɛːnni?
S.TRANSL: We won't work any more," we said.

S.FORM: mɛttumbɛaŋ kɔ taːndi hɔmbhɛaŋ ɔːktɛ phiːktɛ phɛaŋ kɔ khunɛ sərdar ɛn mɛttuaŋ kɔ kubhɛrɛk kubhɛrɛk thiklɔt pəisa mɛbɛrigɛ anigɛ tələb ɛn kɔ.
S.TRANSL: Then he told the contractor that there was shouting and screaming, and they gave us half of our pay.

S.FORM: khɔmbharɔt mɛbɛrigɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ taːndi ni khɔmbhɛ yammu kam dzogumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: That was all they gave us, and we went back to work.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ dui məhina ba anigɛ tələb yuŋɛ bãki .
S.TRANSL: Two months' salary was owed us.

S.FORM: yuŋɛaŋ kɔ khɔnnɛn yuŋɛaŋ kɔ taːndi dzogumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We did the work.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kha luŋdhakke yammu alla naba kɔ dewəl mɛmɛttu —
S.TRANSL: The wall — over there they say "dewal" —

S.FORM: aniɛtmu ani nepal ɛtmu kɔ luŋdhakke amɛttum tərə naba paːn dewəl mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: here in our place — in Nepal — we say "lungdhakke" but in the language over there they say "dewal".

S.FORM: khan dewəl ɛn pura mɛdzogu — dzogum surumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: They finished the wall — we finished building it.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ khatmunu pemen mɛbirigɛ pura .
S.TRANSL: Then they paid us in full.

S.FORM: mɛbirigɛaŋ kɔ pegigɛ yammu na.
S.TRANSL: They paid us and we went on further.

S.FORM: martam roɖ mɛmɛttub'ɛtmu pegigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We went to a place called ?Martam Road.

S.FORM: əbə martam roɖ ɛtmu hatmu yagigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed at Martam Road.

S.FORM: yagigɛaŋ kɔ khatna ərko sərdar thik kami sərdar thik yagɛ.
S.TRANSL: Over there there was a kami [blacksmith] contractor.

S.FORM: khɔnnɛn tɛmsumbɛaŋ khatmu kam cogumbɛ — the.
S.TRANSL: We latched on to him and worked.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ taːndi khapmu uhi khapmuaŋ bərkhə bhəri yagigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed all monsoon long.

S.FORM: yagigɛ yagigɛ taːndi khɔmbhɛ khapmu yammu bəhidar thiknu — rai bəhidar thik yagɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed on, and later, with a clerk — there was a Rai clerk.

S.FORM: khɔ rai bəhidar ɛnnu kɔ khesigɛ anchigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We quarreled with that Rai.

S.FORM: khesigɛ'llɛ kɔ "khɛnɛ nurik kam kɛndzoknɛn" mɛttaŋ.
S.TRANSL: He told me, "You don't work properly."

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ "abhe phɛaŋ iŋga kam mɛdzokŋan?
S.TRANSL: "How can you say I don't work properly!

S.FORM: əru bhənda iŋga kudopma kam cokŋaba.
S.TRANSL: I'm working harder than the others.

S.FORM: khɛnɛ theaŋ kɛdɔnnaba? ɛmdaŋba coguŋlɔ pɔtŋa, theaŋ kɛbhɛkŋa?" pha mɛttuŋ iŋga. …
S.TRANSL: Why do you scold me? I'm working like this — why do you scold me?" I said. [break in recording]

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ khɔmbha bəhidar lɛ tɔrigɛ tɔraŋ kam cokmasaŋ ekdəm adɔnbarɔt khɔllɛ.
S.TRANSL: That clerk scolded us — he scolded me, even though we worked, he just kept scolding us.

S.FORM: ?? adɔnbarɔt.
S.TRANSL: He just kept scolding us.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khɔmbhɛllɛ adzum thiknu anchigɛ səllah cogusigɛ.
S.TRANSL: So we talked it over, me and a friend.

S.FORM: cogusigɛaŋ kɔ "khannɛn ləu ɛn bəhidar ɛn hipsu!
S.TRANSL: "OK, let's beat that clerk up!

S.FORM: hipsuaŋ kɔ bəru anchi tələb aŋ maya mar coksuaŋ kɔ niŋsaŋ puksuaŋ kɔ pitchi!
S.TRANSL: Let's beat him up — we'll forget our salary, let's just forget about it and leave!

S.FORM: bəru ərko ʈhaũ kam coksɛ pitchi!" phɛaŋ kɔ anchigɛ səllah cogusigɛ adzum thiknu.
S.TRANSL: Let's go work somewhere else instead!" we said, me and my friend.

S.FORM: khɔ adzummɛn kɔ khɔmbhɛaŋ adzummɛllɛ paːttu, "mɛːn, thikyaːn niyaːn səhə ba cokma, theaŋ allo sikkɛllɛ kɔ hirɔt co," lɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then my friend said, "No, we'll put up with it for a day or two. Because if one gets angry one only eats shit later."

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ iŋga səhə ba coguŋ.
S.TRANSL: So I bore with it.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ chə sat din kuegaŋ kɔ yammu — yammu khesigɛ kha bəhidar nu.
S.TRANSL: Then six or seven days afterwards we quarreled again with that clerk.

S.FORM: khesigɛaŋ kɔ khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ mɛttuŋ, adzummɛn mɛttuŋ —
S.TRANSL: Then I told him — I told my friend — [??]

S.FORM: iŋga gɔ ɛmdaŋ kɔ jhyampwal the mɛndzo phəruwa therɔt cəluwə kɛdzokpa,
S.TRANSL: I was just an ordinary laborer, using a crowbar,

S.FORM: kha adzummɛn cəĩ gɔ mistri — alla naba paːn kɔ " mistri " mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: but that friend of mine was a mason — in the language over there they say "mistri".

S.FORM: ɛtnaba ani kɔ " kərmi " mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: Over here we say "karmi".

S.FORM: tərə khɔnnɛn mɛttuŋŋaŋ kɔ khallɛ kɔ abhe cogu phɛllɛ,
S.TRANSL: But I was saying [??], what he did was —

S.FORM: "alla ɛmbhɛ luŋŋɛn chino lɛ mɛghɔktu thɛk thɛklɛ mɛghɔktu.
S.TRANSL: they were cutting stone with chisels, "thek-thek".

S.FORM: mɛghɔktuaŋ khɔnnɛn kɔ khɔmlɔrik kam dzoknu yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: They were cutting stone and he was doing that kind of work.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ bahrə bəje poŋma cogɛ, khaja cama bela poksɛ.
S.TRANSL: It got to be noon, it was time for a snack.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ cambɛ khaja the cambɛ waːttumbɛaŋ khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ əru rɛ mɛdzo mɛsuru,
S.TRANSL: We were eating some snack and the others had finished eating.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ iŋga kɔ mɛndza mɛnchuttɛ wayaŋ.
S.TRANSL: I hadn't finished eating.

S.FORM: caŋlɔ yuŋaŋ khaja .
S.TRANSL: I was still eating.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ ɔːktɛ bəhidar ɛn kɔ " ləu ləu ləu ləu poginnɛ poginnɛ!" lɔrik ɔːktɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then the clerk shouted. "OK, OK, get up, get up!" he shouted.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ gɔ "mɛːn iŋga khaja cama khosuŋ khaja mɛndzaɛ waˀa," mɛttuŋ.
S.TRANSL: "No, I get to eat my snack, I haven't eaten," I said.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ gɔ thɛktuk ɔːktɛrɔ y'yɛ.
S.TRANSL: He came down shouting violently.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khaja ŋ mɛndzaɛ tyəttikəi khɔmbhɛ pogaŋŋaŋ kɔ pegaŋ tho.
S.TRANSL: So without eating I got up immediately and went up.

S.FORM: pegaŋŋaŋ kɔ kam cogumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: I went up and we went to work.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ akkho kha adzummɛnnu khan rajaollə nu kɔ khesi.
S.TRANSL: Then later my friend and the master mason quarreled.

S.FORM: ɛmbhɔ luŋ khɔknu yuŋaba kha'llɛ kɔ mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: I was cutting stone.

S.FORM: "khɛnɛ ci asennaŋ tho abhebhai kɛlɔˀ. tɛmbhuk kɛdzaiya" mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: "You've been acting up for some time now. You might get a beating" he said.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛrɔt mɛttuya.
S.TRANSL: That's all he said.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khunɛ kɔ khesi besi kha adzummɛnnu kɔ.
S.TRANSL: Then he quarreled with my friend.

S.FORM: khesiaŋ kɔ khunɛ kɔ bəhidar lɛ kɔ "hipnɛ" phɛaŋ kɔ tokkattɛllɛ ɛmbhɛ saːpsu.
S.TRANSL: The clerk said "I'll beat you," and raised his cane.

S.FORM: saːpsu'llɛ kɔ khan adzummɛllɛ kɔ rajaollə 'llɛ kɔ thɛktuk kha luŋ thɔkma tɔktɔkya'llɛ kɔ ɛmdaŋb'ɛtmu bɛŋ ! mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: He raised it and my friend took the mason's rock-hammer and gave him a blow "bung!" like this [indicating a blow to the head].

S.FORM: hiptu.
S.TRANSL: He hit him.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ hiptu'llɛ kɔ iŋgaŋ phɛŋ! lɔˀ hiptuŋ.
S.TRANSL: I hit him too.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔ hoit lɔˀ loktaŋ.
S.TRANSL: Then I ran away.

S.FORM: ərko khan bəhidar ɛllɛ kudzummɛllɛ kɔ yammu ɛmbhɔ thaŋ ɖil ɛtmu uːŋŋasiŋ pegaŋŋɛllɛ khoca 'llɛ lɛm! mɛttaŋ.
S.TRANSL: But when I was pulling myself up the slope one of that clerk's friends hit me with a stake.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ mu ɔgaŋaŋ th'yaŋ.
S.TRANSL: I lost my hold and fell down.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ adzummɛllɛ ərko nnaŋ bɛŋ! lɔˀ hiptu.
S.TRANSL: My friend struck the other one too.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yammu bəhidar rɛ yammu hiptu.
S.TRANSL: Then the clerk hit him [i.e. the narrator's friend].

S.FORM: hiptuaŋ akkho kɔ ɛtmu kaːndɛ.
S.TRANSL: He hit him and later he had a wound here [indicating his head].

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ tɛktuk makkhi phɔdɔŋdɔŋba makkhi lɔːndɛ.
S.TRANSL: Blood came gushing out.

S.FORM: makkhi lɔːndɛaŋ kɔ kumakkhin kɔ cɛtthiya'tmu khɔmbh'yarik mɛdaːktu mɛnɛssu.
S.TRANSL: They collected his blood in a bowl.

S.FORM: mɛdaːktu mɛnɛssuaŋ kɔ khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ mɛdaːktu.
S.TRANSL: They collected it.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ "alla kheŋŋasigɛaŋ kɔ siŋtam thana 'tmu teˀasigɛ mɛmɛttigɛ.
S.TRANSL: "Now we'll tie you up and take you to the police station in Singtam," they told us.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ anigɛ tələb aŋ yɔllik mɛyuŋɛn.
S.TRANSL: We didn't have much pay outstanding.

S.FORM: məhina thikpa ek səu pəccas saʈhi thik yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: There was one month's pay — about one hundred fifty or sixty.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ anigɛ khan adzummɛn kɔ hoit lɔrik khɛtnasigɛaŋ kɔ pesigɛ.
S.TRANSL: So we ran away right then.

S.FORM: pesigɛaŋ kɔ sɛndiksa hoit lɔrik pesigɛ,
S.TRANSL: We went, even though it was night.

S.FORM: anchigɛ tələb aŋ maya mar cogusigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We kissed goodbye to our pay.

S.FORM: cogusigɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ mu siŋtam lɔːndɛsigɛaŋ kɔ yammu bəs ɛtmu pesigɛ yo romphu pesigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We came out down in Singtam and went by bus to Romphu.

S.FORM: romphu pesigɛaŋ kɔ khatmu tin din car din nɛssɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed there three or four days.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ khatmu kam mɛŋghoba.
S.TRANSL: There was no work there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ ?? darjiliŋ kɛrɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then we went over to Darjeeling.

S.FORM: darjiliŋ kɛrɛsigɛaŋ khatmu sɔpma wayɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: When we reached Darjeeling we stayed a short while.

S.FORM: pəisa yɔllik mɛŋgɔppa.
S.TRANSL: We didn't have much money.

S.FORM: car səi pãc səi thik pəisa kɔttusigɛ wayɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We had four or five hundred.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ ɛn darjiliŋ tak kɔndusigɛ the bepar thik cogusigɛ'llɛ uhi pəisa mɛgɛ.
S.TRANSL: We toured around Darjeeling and did a little business and our money ran out.

S.FORM: pəisa mɛgɛaŋ kɔ thaŋɛsigɛ ɛttho.
S.TRANSL: So we came up here.

S.FORM: yammu romphu thaŋɛsigɛaŋ kɔ romphu nu na pãc mail mɛmɛttuba thik nɛssɛ.
S.TRANSL: We came back up to Romphu — there was a place called "Five Mile".

S.FORM: kumiŋŋɛnnaŋ nurik aniŋwa mɛyaknɛn.
S.TRANSL: I don't remember its name properly.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khɔ pãc mail mɛmɛttub'ɛtmu pesigɛaŋ kɔ khatmu uhi lam dɔma yagɛsigɛ khatmu.
S.TRANSL: At that place called Five Mile we got into that same road-digging work.

S.FORM: khatmu məhina thik kam cogusigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We worked for a month there.

S.FORM: məhina thik kam cogusigɛaŋ kɔ khatmunu kɔ lammɛn pura cuːrɛ.
S.TRANSL: After we'd worked a month, the road was completed.

S.FORM: cuːrɛaŋ kɔ yammu tho phədamchin mɛtmunaba caina lɛ simana pər ba kɛdzokpa'tmu yagɛsigɛ tho.
S.TRANSL: After that we stayed up at a place called Phodomchin, next to the Chinese border.

S.FORM: hattho pesigɛ yagɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed up there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ khapmu tərə khan miliʈeri ɖipaʈ mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: They call it "Military Depot".

S.FORM: khɔn miliʈeri ɖipaʈ ɛn pesigɛaŋ kɔ phədamchiŋ ɛtmu yagɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We went to that Military Depot and stayed in Phodamchin.

S.FORM: yagɛsigɛ taːndi məhina sumsi khapmu yagɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed there three months.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khallɛ kɔ khapmunuaŋ kɔ bahrə bəje tɔːk cam'naba —
S.TRANSL: Up there it was lunch at noon —

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔrɔ bela tɔːk cambɛ. khɔmbhɛaŋ ni taːndi pegigɛaŋ tin məhina kɛrɛaŋ kɔ kɛrɛaŋ kɔ bahrə bəje tɔːk cam'naba bela blastiŋ mɛbhɔksuba.
S.TRANSL: We ate lunch at noon. After about three months, at lunch time they set off explosives.

S.FORM: alla na kɔ blastiŋ mɛmɛttu, ɛtna kɔ anigɛ kɔ — anigɛ kɔ top mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: Over there they say "blasting", here in our place they say "top" [cannon].

S.FORM: blastiŋ mɛbhɔksuaŋ kɔ mɛbhɔksu'llɛ bela iŋga tɔːk caŋlɔ yuŋaŋ bahrə bəje .
S.TRANSL: When they set off the explosives I was eating my meal — at noon.

S.FORM: caŋlɔ yuŋaŋ khɔmbhɛllɛ abhedaŋba phɛllɛ khambekkɛtmu nɛma hop ɛmbha thaŋ ɛmbha khaʈ cokmaŋ kɔ siŋŋɛllɛ khaʈ cokma khɔtthaŋ nɛm'naba,
S.TRANSL: How I was eating — now there one doesn't sleep on the ground — they make beds out of wood and they lie down on those.

S.FORM: tərə adzumhaˀ cəĩ ərko ʈhaũ phukko'tmu mɛdziŋsiŋ, iŋga cəĩ mɛndziŋbasiŋ.
S.TRANSL: My friends had hidden in another place, in a cave, but I wasn't hidden.

S.FORM: khan khaʈ ɛllɛmu kusikkɛtmu nɛssaŋŋaŋ ɛmbhɛ nɛssaŋŋaŋ kɔ tɔːkkɛn ɛmbha caŋlɔ nɛssaŋ.
S.TRANSL: I was under the bed eating my meal.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔrɔ khan blastiŋ ɛn phɔktɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then the explosives went off.

S.FORM: ɛnkhɛpmunu mail thik the phərak ɛtmu phɔktɛba blastiŋ ɛn.
S.TRANSL: It went off about a mile away, the explosive.

S.FORM: phɔktɛllɛ kɔ tɛktuk ɛnyaːppa luŋŋɛn iːrɛ phɛrɛaŋ kɔ hoit lɔrik phɛrɛaŋ kɔ thaŋ təmbu alla ɛmbhɛllɛ — təmbu khiŋm'naŋ pɔt —
S.TRANSL: When it went off, rocks this big came spinning over the tent — there were tents set up.

S.FORM: khan təmbu n pəɖyaŋ ! hɔŋsuaŋ gɔ khan təram ɛtmu khaʈ ɛtmu cuktɛaŋ kɔ khaʈ ɛn tərəp ! piːksɛaŋ kɔ aekkɛn lɛm! lɔˀ hiptu.
S.TRANSL: It pierced the tent and landed on the bed and one of the slats came out and hit my back.

S.FORM: hiptuaŋ ɛtmu phiŋba thɔktuaŋ pɔtchɛ.
S.TRANSL: It made a black and blue mark.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ taːndi khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ ɛtyo həspiʈal mɛyuːraŋ həspiʈal kam cogaŋ — sidaˀ the mɛbɛraŋ.
S.TRANSL: Later they took me down to the hospital and the hospital treated me — they gave me some medicine.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ taːndi cɛ wettaŋ begaŋ, mendzo aruhəru sallik kɛdukpa the cakar mɛttuŋsiŋ.
S.TRANSL: Later I got a bit better and I took a little care of the others who were seriously ill.

S.FORM: khɔmbha khɔmbhɛ lɔrik wayaŋlɔ taːndi kɔ amba ahɔŋsɛ phɛrɛ.
S.TRANSL: While I was there like that, later my father came to look for me.

S.FORM: "pitchi!" lɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: "Let's go!" he said.

S.FORM: amba ahɔŋsɛ phɛrɛaŋ kɔ khɔmbhɛ phɛri besigɛ.
S.TRANSL: My father came to look for me and we came back.

S.FORM: phɛrɛsigɛ. khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ ɛtna bijənbari mɛmɛttub'ɛtmu kɛrɛsigɛaŋ kɔ khapmu anigɛ n'ya thik yuŋ.
S.TRANSL: Then when we got over here to a place called Bijanbari, there's a maternal aunt of ours there.

S.FORM: bijənbari khɔmbhɛaŋ khatmu niyaːn the nɛssɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed two days or so in Bijanbari.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ hoit lɔrik phɛrɛ pesigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We came quickly away from there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ ɛtna sat din aʈh din lɔˀ himmu kɛrɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: After seven or eight days we reached home.
